briefdescription.para: Size of the Tic-Tac-Toe board.
Symbol representing player X.
Symbol representing player O.
Game mode: Man vs Man.
Game mode: Man vs AI.
Game mode: AI vs AI.
The game board.
Indicates whether the game has started.
Current game mode.
Last move made by the server (for AI games).
Number of moves made in the current game.
Current player in AI vs AI mode.
Initializes the Arduino.
Main game loop.
Starts a new game and resets the board.
Sets the game mode based on the input command.

parameterdescription.para: The received command containing the mode.

briefdescription.para: Handles moves in Man vs Man mode.
Handles moves in Man vs AI mode.
Handles moves in AI vs AI mode.

parameterdescription.para: The received command (unused in this mode).

briefdescription.para: Makes a move for a player.

simplesect.para: True if the move is valid, false otherwise.

briefdescription.para: Makes a move for the AI.

parameterdescription.para: The calculated AI move as row and column indices.

briefdescription.para: Checks if a board position is valid.

simplesect.para: True if the position is valid, false otherwise.

briefdescription.para: Checks the status of the game.

simplesect.para: True if the game has ended, false otherwise.

briefdescription.para: Resets the game board to its initial state.
Checks if a player has won the game.

parameterdescription.para: The player symbol to check for a win.

simplesect.para: True if the player has won, false otherwise.

briefdescription.para: Checks if the game board is full.

simplesect.para: True if the board is full, false otherwise.

briefdescription.para: Prints the current state of the board in a graphical format to the Serial monitor.
Gets the opponent's symbol for a given player.
Minimax algorithm to determine the best score for a given player.

parameterdescription.para: The depth of the recursive search.

simplesect.para: The best score for the current player.

briefdescription.para: Finds the best move for the AI using the Minimax algorithm.

parameterdescription.para: An array to store the row and column indices of the best move.

briefdescription.para: Arduino implementation of a Tic-Tac-Toe game server with multiple modes.
